intro: Stylidium monticola, commonly known as the mountain stickseed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae, which includes plants known for their striking floral displays. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically red or orange in color. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. Stylidium monticola is adapted to arid conditions and is known for its ability to survive in nutrient-poor environments.
